title: Fighting boots

properties.name: description
properties.value: Fighting boots are a pair of low level boots with stats identical to bronze boots and fancy boots. They are obtained from the Cradle of Life on the fourth level of the Stronghold of Security dungeon provided the player's account has two-factor authentication enabled. They are used by new or free-to-play players, as the Cradle rewards 10,000 coins along with the choice between fancy boots or fighting boots.

Item ID9006

Fighting boots are a pair of low level boots with stats identical to bronze boots and fancy boots. They are obtained from the Cradle of Life on the fourth level of the Stronghold of Security dungeon provided the player's account has two-factor authentication enabled. They are used by new or free-to-play players, as the Cradle rewards 10,000 coins along with the choice between fancy boots or fighting boots.

The boots disappear on death, but can be reclaimed from the Cradle at no cost.

They used to be the best melee boots in free-to-play, but have since been surpassed by all of the Castle Wars decorative boots, especially the decorative boots (gold) due to their Strength bonus. The high requirement of 400 castle wars tickets causes the fighting boots to still be popular, due to its nonexistent cost.

[[File:Fighting boots detail.png|120px|left]]
'''Fighting boots''' are a pair of low level boots with stats identical to [[bronze boots]] and [[fancy boots]]. They are obtained from the [[Cradle of Life]] on the fourth level of the [[Stronghold of Security]] dungeon provided the player's account has two-factor authentication enabled. They are used by new or [[free-to-play]] players, as the Cradle rewards {{NoCoins|10000}} [[coins]] along with the choice between [[fancy boots]] or fighting boots.

The boots disappear on death, but can be reclaimed from the Cradle at no cost.

They used to be the best melee [[boots]] in free-to-play, but have since been surpassed by all of the [[Castle Wars]] [[decorative boots]], especially the [[decorative boots (gold)]] due to their [[Strength bonus]]. The high requirement of 400 [[castle wars tickets]] causes the fighting boots to still be popular, due to its nonexistent cost.
